actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to extend the period in which application may be made for exemption, on account of religious tenets or teachings, from the Federal self-employment tax.

summary.text: Amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to extend until December 31, 1977, the period during which a member of a recognized religious sect or division thereof may apply for exemption from the tax on self-employment income if such member is opposed, because of his religious beliefs, to acceptance of the benefits of any insurance which makes payments in the event of death, disability, old-age, or retirement, or which makes payments for medical care.

titles.title: A bill to extend the period in which application may be made for exemption, on account of religious tenets or teachings, from the Federal self-employment tax.
